original_solution_mapping.L1: Bruce has 20 more legos than Kent who has 40 so Bruce has 20+40 = <<20+40=60>>60 legos
original_solution_mapping.L2: Simon has 20% more legos than Bruce who has 60 legos so that's .20*60 = <<20*.01*60=12>>12 more legos
original_solution_mapping.L3: 20% more is 12 legos and Bruce has 60 so Simon has 12+60 = 72 legos

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4330.
    Returns: the total number of legos Simon has.
    """
    # L1
    bruce_more_than_kent = 20 # 20 more than Kent
    kent_legos = 40 # Kent has 40 legos
    bruce_legos = bruce_more_than_kent + kent_legos

    # L2
    simon_percent_more = 0.20 # 20% more legos
    simon_percent_more_num = 20 # 20% more legos
    percent_factor = 0.01 # WK
    simon_extra_legos = simon_percent_more_num * percent_factor * bruce_legos

    # L3
    simon_total_legos = simon_extra_legos + bruce_legos

    # FA
    answer = simon_total_legos
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Bruce has {bruce_more_than_kent} more legos than Kent who has {kent_legos} so Bruce has {bruce_more_than_kent}+{kent_legos} = <<{bruce_more_than_kent}+{kent_legos}={bruce_legos}>>{bruce_legos} legos

Simon has {simon_percent_more_num}% more legos than Bruce who has {bruce_legos} legos so that's {simon_percent_more}*{bruce_legos} = <<{simon_percent_more_num}*{percent_factor}*{bruce_legos}={simon_extra_legos}>>{simon_extra_legos} more legos
{simon_percent_more_num}% more is {simon_extra_legos} legos and Bruce has {bruce_legos} so Simon has {simon_extra_legos}+{bruce_legos} = {simon_total_legos} legos
